content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's a function named `clean_column` that performs the desired operations on a given column name in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    col = lowercase(col) # Lowercase the column name
    col = strip(col) # Remove leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, r"[ \-]+" => "_") # Replace spaces, hyphens, or multiple whitespaces with an underscore
    col
end
```

You can use this function to clean up column names as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column(" My Column  ")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("My Column_1")
"my_column_1"

julia> clean_column(" My Column_1 ")
"my_column_1"
```
